title: From Washington to Moscow, Indonesia Searches for the Right Nuclear Partner
body: Indonesia aims to have its first nuclear power plant by 2032 as it seeks to cut emissions and reduce its reliance on coal and oil.

title: Indonesia’s Alcohol Industry Contributes Rp 9 Trillion to State Coffers
body: The distinctive characteristics of traditional alcoholic drinks in each region reflect Indonesia’s cultural richness.

title: Rupiah Under Pressure as Indonesia Market Outlook Weighs on Sentiment
body: Rupiah weakened on Thursday as domestic market concerns and investor jitters outweighed a softer US dollar and limited external pressure.

title: Jakarta Stocks Pare Losses but End Lower Following MSCI Assessment
body: JCI closed lower on Thursday as MSCI downgrade concerns kept investors cautious despite heavy trading and sharp intraday swings.

title: Indonesia to Raise Minimum Free Float Requirement to 15% After MSCI Review
body: Indonesia will raise the minimum free float to 15% from 7.5% as regulators respond to MSCI concerns over market transparency.

title: JCI Slumps Nearly 6% After Trading Halt, Touched 10% Intraday
body: JCI slid nearly 6% by midday after a trading halt, having briefly plunged as much as 10% amid heavy selling pressure.

title: UBS, Goldman Cut Indonesia Equity Calls After MSCI Warning
body: UBS and Goldman cut Indonesia stock calls after MSCI warned of investability risks, raising fears of a downgrade and large capital outflows.

title: Merdeka Gold Resources Explores Potential Hong Kong Listing
body: Merdeka Gold Resources said it is in early-stage discussions on a potential share listing in Hong Kong.

title: Antam Gold Hits New All-Time High at Rp 3.16 Mill per Gram as Global Prices Rally
body: Antam gold jumped to a new record of Rp 3.16 million per gram on Thursday, tracking a global bullion rally driven by safe-haven demand.

title: Breaking: JCI Tumbles 8% in First 30 Minutes on Thursday, Trading Halted
body: A sharp early sell-off sent the JCI down 8%, forcing a temporary halt on the Indonesia Stock Exchange.

title: JCI Extends Losses on Thursday Post MSCI Index Freeze Announcement
body: JCI fell further on Thursday morning following MSCI’s announcement of a temporary freeze on index changes for Indonesia.

title: Bio Farma to Let Go of Kimia Farma, Danantara Says
body: Danantara wants state-run enterprises in the health sector to go under the knife, citing differences in their business nature.

title: Market Sell-Off Over MSCI Report Is Temporary, Finance Minister Says
body: Indonesia’s finance minister said the stock sell-off after an MSCI report was excessive and temporary, pledging swift reforms.

title: Rupiah Rebounds on Dollar Weakness Ahead of Fed Decision
body: Rupiah strengthened against the US dollar on Wednesday as markets awaited the Federal Reserve’s policy decision.

title: Danantara Says SOE Consolidation Based on Fundamentals, Not Arbitrary Cuts
body: Danantara said SOE consolidation is based on fundamental reviews, not arbitrary cuts, as Indonesia targets stronger, competitive state firms

title: MSCI Review Triggers Sharp Sell-Off as JCI Slides 7.35%
body: JCI fell 7.35% on Wednesday after MSCI raised fresh investability and free-float concerns, triggering a broad market sell-off.
